result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10;04  AM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel.  Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court w/Jacob Ryan Clemenson. INCLUDES: 22CF593 (PH), 2021CF732, 2021CF865, 2022CF12, 2022CF42, 2022CF104, and 2022CF239 (all STC). Court calls 22CF593 - S/T Officer Tim Rue, Hudson PD; direct by Atty Smestad. Record reflects identity of the DE. Cross by Atty Erdman. Atty Erdman moves for dismissal. Atty Smestad responds. Further cross by Atty Erdman. Attys argue bond over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Erdman notes that there is likely a resolution on all matters. Court confirms address of DE. Bond continues in form and amount. Adjourned: 10:19 am.

INCLUDES 21CF593, 21CF732, 21CF865 and 22CF12 (ARGN). 22CF12: Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. Waives reading. NG. Court notes Atty. per SRN to administratively transfer files to Branch I for a global resolution. sf

Includes 22CF42 and 22CF104 - AMENDED

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

Def to continue to test bi-weekly (once every 2 weeks) with probation agent. Probation to inform the court of any POSITIVE results. A positive result with the agent is subject to bail jumping.  

Defendant to report to Justice Support Center today after court for testing.

09:30 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: S. Fox, ADA:  Karl Anderson, DF ATTY:  Michelle M Erdman, DF:  Jacob Ryan Clemenson appeared. Includes 22CF42 and 22CF104. INIT for 22CF104: Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Def explains he was misunderstood regarding testing requirements. Due to his employment it is difficult for him to appear. Probation agent has agreed to test def weekly. Court orders Def to test today after court. Court amends bonds in 22CF42 and 22CF104 and orders Def to continue to test bi-weekly (once every 2 weeks) with probation agent. Probation to inform the court of any positive results. A positive result with the agent is subject to bail jumping.  
ARGN for 22CF42:   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Not guilty on all counts. A global resolution is possible. Court administrativley assigns files to Branch I. However, if no global resolution,  cases to be returned to Branch III.
